text: Bernardino Piñera Carvallo (22 September 1915 - 21 June 2020) was a Chilean prelate of the Catholic Church. He was born in Paris, France. When he died at age 104, he was the oldest living Catholic bishop. Piñera was ordained as a priest on 5 April 1947 and worked for the Catholic Action. On 11 February 1958, Pope Pius XII appointed Piñera Carvallo auxiliary bishop of Talca. In May 2020, he was diagnosed with COVID-19. Piñera died on 21 June 2020 from pneumonia caused by COVID-19 in Santiago de Chile, aged 104. ==References== ==Other websites== * Catholic Hierarchy Category:1915 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Chile Category:Chilean centenarians Category:Chilean Roman Catholic bishops Category:People from Paris
